column1: Probably none of the Camp Fire Girls had ever been so surprised in their lives as when they heard the object of this utterly unexpected visit. Marcia's eyes were rather blurred while she was speaking
column2: and anyone could see that it was a hard task she had assumed.It is never easy to confess that one has been in the wrong
column3: and it was particularly hard for these girls
column4: whose whole campaign against the Camp Fire party had been based on pride and a false sense of their own superiority
column7: had existed only in their imaginations.For a moment no one seemed to know what to do or say. Strangely enough
column9: who had resented the previous attitude of the rich girls more than any of her companions
column10: who found by instinct the true solution.She didn't say a word; she simply ran forward impulsively and threw her arms about Marcia's neck. Then
column12: as she kissed the friend with whom she had quarreled
